intro: Pilosella euchaetia, commonly known as the hairy hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of hairy, gray-green leaves and produces yellow flowers with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Pilosella euchaetia typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a weed in some regions.
